item.title: A 'return to craft' for the NT's award-winning young artists showcased at this year's Exit Art
item.description: Almost a dozen high school-aged artists have received awards as part of a prestigious Northern Territory showcase, with a number of finalists exhibiting self-portraits.

item.title: Concerns over death of iconic salmon gums in WA's Great Western Woodlands
item.description: Kalgoorlie horticulturalist Phil Stanley says he is struggling to get authorities to take the deaths of more than 100 salmon gums near the mining city seriously.

item.title: Adam Zampa says claims Australia does not care about T20 cricket 'totally false' after World Cup flop
item.description: Adam Zampa hits back at claims that Australia does not care about T20 cricket after a disappointing World Cup campaign.

item.title: The shamans and designer handbags before Yoon Suk Yeol's insurrection conviction
item.description: Former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol's sentence for insurrection comes after a tumultuous era of shamanism, Chanel bags and conspiracy theories.

item.title: Viral AI videos raise questions about how we view reality
item.description: For a bit of a laugh, Travis Marshall uses artificial intelligence to create wacky videos about his hometown, but his light-hearted content also raises serious questions about reality in the age of AI.

item.title: NASA boss blasts Boeing and agency over bungled test flight that left astronauts stranded on space station
item.description: A bungled Boeing mission that left two astronauts stranded on the International Space Station for nine months has been criticised by NASA's new boss.

item.title: Drugs with estimated street value of $1.45 million seized in traffic stop
item.description: A traffic stop on the Pacific Highway on the NSW Mid North Coast has led to the seizure of hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of cocaine and cannabis, police say.

item.title: Farmer builds chapel for Tongan workers, the 'backbone' of her banana farm
item.description: A Queensland banana farmer spent 10 years saving to build a chapel for the Tongan workers who form the backbone of her family’s operation on Cape York Peninsula.

item.title: The US Supreme Court's take-down of Trump's tariffs explained
item.description: The ruling on tariffs is a hugely consequential decision that has infuriated the president, who is now looking for workarounds.

item.title: Punch the baby macaque draws a crowd at Japan's Ichikawa City Zoo
item.description: The six month old macaque's relationship with a soft toy orangutan has become an internet sensation.

item.title: Man charged after allegedly throwing 'lit incendiary device' during Navy chief's speech
item.description: A man faces court accused of throwing a fake explosive device through a Canberra hotel window during a speech from the Chief of Navy.

item.title: Rottnest Swim cancellation prompts dozens to descend on Perth pool
item.description: Weather may have derailed the main event, but some swimmers were determined to complete their own version of the Rottnest Channel Swim in the name of charity.

item.title: Auckland FC defeat Wellington Phoenix 5-0 in A-League Men, goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi own goal begins rout
item.description: Wellington Phoenix goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi commits one of the worst howlers this A-League Men season, heading a clearance kick into his own net as Auckland FC romps to a big win.

item.title: South Australian election countdown officially begins, campaign kicks off
item.description: Election campaigning in South Australia is officially underway, with candidates seizing the opportunity to begin making their formal pitches to voters before they head to the ballot box in March.

item.title: Walker and Reddingius create Aussie Olympic bobsleigh history
item.description: Bree Walker and Kiara Reddingius achieve Australia's best Olympic result in two-woman bobsleigh, as teenager Indra Brown is forced to wait for her chance to compete for a medal.

item.title: Hungary and Slovakia threaten Ukraine over stalled Russian oil shipments
item.description: Hungary and Slovakia, which have both received a temporary exemption from an EU policy prohibiting imports of Russian oil, have accused Ukraine of deliberately holding up supplies.

item.title: Danielle Scott, Cooper Woods named as Winter Olympic Games closing ceremony flag-bearers
item.description: Two of Australia's 2026 Winter Olympic Games medallists, Cooper Woods and Danielle Scott, will carry the flag at the closing ceremony in Verona.

item.title: Albanese government bears inflation pressure while premiers spend big, poll well
item.description: High-spending premiers remain popular and seemingly impervious to the rising cost-of-living anxiety piling pressure on the Albanese government.

item.description: Yerin Ha built a name for herself in local and international productions for almost a decade before transforming into Bridgerton's newest paramour.

item.description: Well, this is cute — you thinking you're a quiz pro. It's time to play … HARD!

item.title: On the front lines of Australia's fight against vaccine hesitancy
item.description: With immunisation rates declining and outbreaks of infectious diseases like measles increasing, the consequences of vaccine hesitancy in Australia are becoming clearer.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was the Queen's rumoured favourite. Did she do too much to protect him?
item.description: It will be up to King Charles to shepherd his family's institution through its darkest hour. But could his own mother have done more to snuff out this crisis before he inherited it?

item.title: A visual guide to the prices that landed Coles in court
item.description: The pricing patterns of these six products show how Coles stands accused of using its Down Down marketing campaign to dupe shoppers.

item.title: The Miracle on Ice, when an unheralded USA team knocked off the mighty USSR
item.description: On this day in 1980, a group of American students pulled off the most unlikely of victories, beating the greatest team in international ice hockey history in the upset of the century. Some even called it a miracle.

item.description: With costs and damage mounting, councils are considering all options, including pulling back from the beaches.

item.description: There is no fairytale for Ellyse Perry in her 350th international match as Smriti Mandhana stars to lead India to a series win over Australia.

item.description: Cumberland Hospital is under investigation after two patients who escaped from its care within 24 hours allegedly caused three people's deaths.

item.title: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo becomes first athlete to win six gold medals at one Winter Olympics
item.description: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo adds to his legacy as the greatest Winter Olympian of all-time by winning his sixth gold of these Olympics and 11th overall.

item.description: Police conduct an operation at Glenorie, a suburb near a house which investigators believe Chris Baghsarian's captors had used as a base.

item.title: Lighthouse keepers' cottages on Pine Islet to be demolished by reef authority
item.description: The remnants of a lighthouse station close to 100 years old on an island off the Mackay coast are set to be dismantled due to asbestos concerns, sparking fears important history will be lost.

item.description: When their station's fragile landscape needed protection from feral goats, Calum and Belinda Carruth seized on an idea that has become marvel of technology and pest management.

item.title: Miner MMG puts forward alternative Rosebery tailings dam site in Exe Valley
item.description: Global mining company MMG has long been seeking to build a third tailings storage dam at its mine on the Tasmanian west coast, in the face of strong opposition from environmentalists. It's now put forward an alternative which conservationists say they won't fight.

item.description: A former child psychiatrist who changed his name after being convicted of child exploitation touched young neurodivergent boys indecently at his practice, a Perth court hears. WARNING: This story contains details that may distress some readers.

item.description: As an eating disorder clinic prepares to open its doors near Mandurah south of Perth, a residential eating disorder clinic is still in the planning stages despite being on the cards for years.

item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.description: About 1,700 poppy plants grown for the pharmaceutical industry have been stolen from a regional property north-west of Melbourne, prompting a warning from the state health department.

item.description: The cross-country rail line connecting Australia's east and west has been closed after heavy rain and flash flooding washed away significant sections of track, the corridor's manager says.

item.title: Coalition calls to criminalise assistance to ISIS-linked Australians seeking to return
item.description: The federal opposition proposes a new criminal offence to punish those who help Australians with links to Islamic State to return home, accusing the government of being complacent about the possible return of 34 wives and children of former fighters.

item.description: Four months ago, Indra Brown had not even competed in a senior World Cup event. Her fifth-placed finish in her maiden Winter Olympics proves her meteoric rise is no fluke.

item.title: Australian Antarctic Program relies on ice runway at Wilkins Aerodrome
item.description: The ice runway at Wilkins Aerodrome is a critical asset in the Australian Antarctic Program, but getting it ready for flights is nothing short of extreme.

item.title: Simon Gordon's endometriosis surgeries were gynaecology's open secret. Now colleagues and patients are speaking out
item.description: Complaints had been made about this gynaecologist for years. Only when hospital management discovered that Four Corners was looking into his practice, did it start investigating further.

item.description: Intergenerational inequality will only be dealt with by taxing the people that have the money, not by cutting the taxes of those who don't have it.

item.description: British actor Robert Aramayo has beaten frontrunners Timothée Chalamet and Leonardo DiCaprio to take the leading actor BAFTA.

item.description: Mount Gambier man Ben Whitehead's world changed when he was diagnosed with lymphoma and initially given three months to live, but he's doing his best to stay positive.

item.description: Police say they have found stolen property and a firearm linked to the incident.

item.description: Experts say creating awareness around how homebirthing and freebirthing differ is important in helping women make informed and safe decisions.

item.title: Peter Mandelson, former UK ambassador to US, released on bail as Epstein files fallout continues
item.description: Peter Mandelson, a political powerbroker and former government minister, has been investigated by London's Metropolitan Police for about three weeks over allegations of misconduct in public office.

item.title: Power supply for Macquarie Point stadium not yet costed or planned as key deadlines approach
item.description: Major upgrades to Hobart's power grid to supply the Macquarie Point stadium are yet to be finalised or costed, with the final estimate for the precinct's energy demand increasing by almost 50 per cent in a year.

item.title: Trump's dispute with Denmark over Greenland 'far from over', warns intelligence expert
item.description: A former chief analyst with the Danish Defence Intelligence Service warns diplomatic efforts to settle the Greenland dispute will fail.

item.title: Could Canada and Australia form a critical minerals supergroup?
item.description: Canberra's decision to sign a bilateral agreement with Canada to join forces on everything to do with critical minerals could prove to be a forerunner of things to come.

item.title: Australian exporters on notice as Trump tariff policy thrown into uncertainty
item.description: Business representatives have warned all Australian exporters they will need to monitor US trade policy carefully over coming weeks and months, as one firm owner estimates tariffs have cost him $1 million.

item.title: Regulator 'dropped the ball' by dismissing complaints about gynaecologist's practices, expert says
item.description: Australia's medical regulator, AHPRA, faces criticism for failing to act on complaints from patients about surgeries by Melbourne gynaecologist Simon Gordon.

item.title: Urgent care clinics ease emergency department demand but wait times unchanged
item.description: An independent review finds Labor's urgent care clinics face workforce shortages and problems with after-hours services, with no evidence hospital waiting times have improved.

item.title: Peter Mandelson arrested at residence in London
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro speaks to ABC Sport's Amanda Shalala.
item.description: Sport news, live scores, features, analysis and photos from the world of sport. Comprehensive coverage of AFL, cricket, football, rugby league and rugby union. Audio interviews. News stories and highlights in video. Sports news bulletin.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro says 'we want to be a dominant force in Asia'
item.description: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro, who has had nine months in charge leading into the Women's Asian Cup starting this week, has bold ambitions for the tournament and the future of women's football.

item.title: Regional Victoria among the worst areas for meth use police say after Shepparton bust
item.description: Police say methylamphetamine trafficking is "insidious" in regional Victoria, with almost one trafficker a week charged over the past year.

item.title: DV attacker photographed victim giving evidence, found guilty of contempt of court
item.description: A man standing trial for domestic violence charges took an image of the victim while she was giving evidence and recorded the prosecutor inside the court building, a court has heard.

item.title: Her son enlisted to fight for Ukraine. When his body was identified, it brought relief
item.description: Ruslana Bronovytska's son Dima did not tell her he was signing up to fight for Ukraine. When he went missing, it was the beginning of a new, hellish reality many people in the country face.

item.title: Agencies put on notice to produce documents for antisemitism inquiry
item.description: A landmark royal commission begins today to probe the prevalence of antisemitism in Australia and shed light on the events surrounding the Bondi Beach terror attack.

item.title: Solomon Islands denies China will run new police station in the heart of the capital Honiara
item.description: Authorities in Solomon Islands deny claims that Chinese police will run a new police post in Honiara's Chinatown district, but say Chinese police will instead "visit" the site.

item.title: Trump Tower pitched as Gold Coast magnet for wealthy but others prefer he 'kept himself in America'
item.description: A $1.5 billion Trump-branded skyscraper proposed for Surfers Paradise is being pitched as a major luxury tourism and investment draw for the Gold Coast, though some locals and visitors say the name could turn people away.

item.title: Hope south-east Queensland koala population can recover but advocates remain wary
item.description: Urbanisation has decimated south east Queensland's koala population, but new analysis suggests the decline has slowed in some areas.

item.title: Nathan Cleary's ban overturned as father acts as counsel at NRL judiciary
item.description: Ivan Cleary's legal prowess comes in handy as his son, Panthers star Nathan Cleary, sees his two-match suspension overturned at the NRL judiciary.

item.title: Crimes against humanity hearings against former Philippine leader Rodrigo Duterte open in The Hague
item.description: An International Criminal Court prosecutor tells judges that former Philippines president Rodrigo Duterte personally instructed members of a death squad to kill suspected criminals and drug users.

item.title: Live: 'Australia likes being first': PM defends bid to remove Andrew from succession
item.description: The prime minister has revealed he voluntarily wrote to his UK counterpart to offer his support for removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the line of succession. Follow live.

item.title: Inspection reveals substandard housing for PALM scheme workers in Gippsland
item.description: Migrant workers in Victoria's east were made to pay $190 a week to their employer for overcrowded, mouldy accommodation.

item.title: Nick Reiner pleads not guilty to murder of parents Rob and Michele Singer Reiner
item.description: Nick Reiner has pleaded not guilty to two counts of first-degree murder in the fatal stabbing of his parents in December last year.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn narrowly dodged amputation after Winter Olympics crash left leg 'in pieces'
item.description: Lindsey Vonn credits her orthopaedic surgeon for being in Italy in the nick of time to save her left leg after her nightmare crash at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Economist warns rural NSW shires are on the verge of financial ruin
item.description: Huge areas, spiralling costs and a small revenue base do not add up for a growing number of councils in NSW.

item.title: Live: BHP hits record high before ASX falls amid tariff uncertainty on Wall Street
item.description: With more tariff chaos from US President Donald Trump, unsettling stocks globally, the ASX 200 is in the red on Tuesday, despite opening trading slightly higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: William Barton on blending the ancient First Nations instrument, the yidaki, with classical music
item.description: Virtuoso William Barton, renowned for bringing together First Nations culture and European classical music, reflects on heritage and the lifelong pull of the yidaki.

item.title: SA wildlife carers help animals hurt in Deep Creek fires as they emerge from refuges
item.description: As the firefighters packed up and went home from the recent Deep Creek fires, other volunteers were just starting weeks of work finding injured wildlife in the charred landscape.

item.title: Carney plans Australia trip to tighten trade and defence ties after warning of world order 'rupture'
item.description: The Canadian government confirms details of Prime Minister Mark Carney's trip to Australia, where he hopes to deepen ties on trade, defence and critical minerals as his country looks to reduce reliance on the US.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ community mourns death of Australian drag performer Maxi Shield
item.description: Maxi Shield was a veteran of the Australian drag scene and a regular performer at venues across Sydney's Oxford Street.

item.title: NFL players and coaches pay tribute to Rondale Moore after shock death of Vikings wide receiver
item.description: The NFL mourns after the shock death of Vikings wide receiver Rondale Moore.

item.title: Alcoa under investigation for alleged breaches of state mining agreement
item.description: Just days after being forced to pay $55 million for unlawfully clearing land in the world's only jarrah forest, it is revealed Alcoa is under investigation for alleged breaches of its agreement with the WA government.

item.title: BAFTA and BBC apologise for racial slur during awards show
item.description: Tourette syndrome advocate John Davidson, who shouted the slur, says it is not a reflection of his personal beliefs.

item.title: Homeless mother refused social housing after Centrelink payments deemed too high
item.description: Welfare payments are Rissa Blakely's only source of income, but she and her kids have been left with no choice but to live in a park.

item.title: Shimron Hetmyer blasts West Indies to record T20 World Cup score in win over Zimbabwe
item.description: Shimron Hetmyer takes advantage of a dropped chance to blast his way to 85 as the West Indies maintain their unbeaten record at this year's T20 World Cup.

item.title: Volunteer firefighters wasting hours 'babysitting' pole-top fires waiting for Western Power crews
item.description: Volunteer firefighters in regional Western Australia say fatigued crews are frustrated over time spent monitoring pole-top fires before Western Power crews travel to the scene.

item.title: SA Liberal Party indicates One Nation preference as Alex Antic meets with Cory Bernardi
item.description: The South Australian Liberal Party has indicated it may direct preferences to One Nation ahead of Labor and the Greens. It comes as prominent Liberal senator Alex Antic was spotted having drinks with One Nation's lead SA candidate Cory Bernardi, amid speculation over a possible defection.

item.title: Security screening at Burnie Airport could drive airlines away, airport boss warns
item.description: Burnie Airport has been told it will need to introduce security screening, but the airport's director says the cost of doing so will make some services commercially unviable and threaten the airport.

item.title: Victorian premier refers surgeon Simon Gordon allegations to police after Four Corners revelations
item.description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has referred allegations against gynaecologist Simon Gordon to police, but the government will not conduct its own investigation.

item.title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao confirm rematch 11 years after 'Fight of the Century'
item.description: Manny Pacquiao has a chance to face Floyd Mayweather again as the American star comes out of retirement for a blockbuster rematch.

item.title: Sunshine Coast's iconic venue Solbar to close after more than 20 years
item.description: The Sunshine Coast's longest-running live music venue will close this weekend, after more than 20 years of hosting artists and performers.

item.title: Bunbury backpacker hostels ordered to close after asbestos, safety warnings ignored
item.description: Two backpacker hostels in Western Australia's largest regional city have been ordered to shut due to serious health and safety concerns, including asbestos exposure risks.

item.title: The 'first-night effect': Why it's hard to sleep when you're somewhere new
item.description: It's night-time and you're exhausted. But the hotel bed feels wrong. The mini fridge won't stop making that low, irritating hum. The power outlet lights feel brighter than the sun.

item.title: Farmers rally against 96 million litres per year Southern Downs water extraction and bottling facility
item.description: A developer has lodged an application with a rural Queensland council to build a water bottling, storage and export facility.

item.title: More than 70 dead after Mexico's biggest drug lord 'El Mencho' killed
item.description: At least 73 people have died in the attempt to capture cartel leader Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes and in the aftermath of his death.

item.title: Live: Police suspect human remains to be abducted Sydney man
item.description: Eighty-five-year-old Chris Baghsarian was mistakenly snatched from his North Ryde property about 5am on February 13.

item.title: Opposition leader to boycott swearing-in of controversial new NT administrator David Connolly
item.description: Northern Territory Opposition Leader Selena Uibo says she will boycott the swearing-in of incoming administrator David Connolly, whose appointment has been embroiled in controversy due to a series of past social media posts.

item.title: Sam Walsh's eight-year contract extension the biggest deal in Carlton's history
item.description: Carlton locks down Sam Walsh to a massive eight-year contract extension as he turns down the lure of free agency.

item.title: Is couples counselling right for me and will the therapist take sides? An expert explains
item.description: Many people seek out couples counselling when going through a rough patch, or wondering how to improve their relationship. So, how do you decide if it's right for you?

item.title: More than 300 Tasmania Fire Service volunteers to be terminated after failing to complete child safety training
item.description: More than 300 Tasmania Fire Service volunteers will be terminated after they failed to do mandatory child safety training, commissioner Jeremy Smith says.

item.title: Grace Tame abuser Nicolaas Bester unfit to stand trial over alleged 'menacing' social media posts
item.description: Nicolaas Ockert Bester has been deemed unfit to stand trial in the Hobart Magistrates Court over three counts of using a carriage service to menace, harass or cause offence.

item.title: Classic car set to save lives
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Donated VL Holden Commodore serviced by 700 apprentices to be auctioned for charity
item.description: Fifteen years, 700 apprentices and now the potential to save several lives, this classic VL Holden Commodore has become more than the sum of its parts.

item.title: Trump Tower developer Altus Property Group's David Young has twice gone bankrupt
item.description: A search by the ABC of federal insolvency records reveals the developer has had personal financial scrapes.

item.title: Australia confirms first full men's tour of South Africa since 2018 ball-tampering scandal
item.description: Steve Smith will be one of five Australian players from the infamous 2018 tour to return to South Africa later this year.

item.title: For some families, the social media ban has made things harder. Here's why
item.description: We spoke with three parents about how it has impacted their family and the different choices they are making around the ban.

item.title: Kash Patel and US men's hockey team under fire after Donald Trump makes joke about women's team
item.description: Viral video of Trump's White House invitation to the US men's hockey team sparks backlash online after the president jokes he would be 'impeached' if he did not also include the gold-medal winning women's team.

item.title: TasWater continues to push for higher water bills, despite regulator knock back
item.description: TasWater has continued to press its case for a steep water bill hike, despite the economic regulator's decision to halve its proposed price earlier this month.

item.title: Farmers are sick of being called 'resilient' and researchers say it's causing real harm
item.description: Farmers and mental health experts say it is time to stop calling farmers "resilient", with concerns it is making it harder for people to ask for, or be offered, help.

item.title: Winter storm blankets north-east US in snow
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Blizzard hits US Northeast bringing cities to standstill, closing schools and disrupting flights
item.description: A record-breaking snowstorm pummels the north-eastern United States, bringing cities to a near-standstill for millions of residents.

item.title: WA Parliament to debate institutional child sex abuse laws in wake of 'retrograde' High Court decision
item.description: A tense political fight is brewing over the future of laws to compensate survivors of institutional child sexual abuse, as the government faces pressure to expand its scope beyond just churches and religious institutions.

item.title: Jennifer Garner and Judy Greer gush about Aussie Angourie Rice
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Former Matildas label new Football Australia membership program a 'silencing mechanism'
item.description: A new membership program launched by Football Australia puts former Matildas players in a difficult position if they want to criticise the governing body.

item.title: Vance Joy on coming back to Melbourne and touring with Ed Sheeran
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police identify Katherine Sanowski as woman found dead at Bellbird Park house as they launch murder investivation
item.description: A 34-year-old found nearby, known to the victim, is receiving a medical assessment and is yet to speak to police.
